Description: is a workflow management system that allows your customers to define purchasing and clearance limits within their Company Account structure
Name: Approval Process

Description:
Add and remove products by simply selecting the desired quantity on PDP and PLP.
Persistent cart
Name: Cart Functionality & Calculations

Description: Landing page to manage a cart. Edit qty/remove items, add note per item, redeem code, totals, merchandizing areas (e.g. Similar products)
Name: Cart page

Description: Management of Login, Register or Checkout as a guest
Name: Checkout step - customer

ID: Cart & Checkout-Checkout step - delivery & billing addresses
Name: Checkout step - delivery & billing addresses

Description: Allow user to choose payment method from multiple payment methods
Name: Checkout step - payment

Description: Information on placed order
Name: Checkout step - place order

Description: Splitting the marketplace order into different shipments based on merchants who will process them (checkout step);
Name: Checkout step - split delivery

Description: Success information on placed order
Name: Checkout step - success

Description: Selection of delivery address and delivery time
Name: Checkout step - shipment

Description: With the flexible Comments Widget you are free to decide where in your web shop comments should be allowed.
Name: Comments Widget

Description: Custom Order Reference allows B2B customers to add a reference to an external system on the order
Name: Custom Order Reference

Description: Download cart item list as CSV or Excell
Name: Download cart items
Comments: Only one, CSV, format is estimated.

Description: Set a minimum/maximum order value for any of products
Name: Global thresholds

Description: In the import file, you can set three values for quantity restrictions: minimum, maximum, and interval. The minimum value defines the smallest allowable quantity of a specific item in the cart. The maximum quantity restricts the allowable quantity of items in the cart to a specific value. The interval value determines an increment value by which the quantity can be changed.
Name: Configuration of non-splittable products

Description:
Logged in users may have multiple carts and switch between them.
Possible actions to manage shopping carts: edit name, duplicate, share, dismiss, delete, switch cart to the shopping list
Name: Multi Cart

Description:
The Persistent Cart Sharing feature lets company users generate the URL to share the cart with different access levels.
Customers can share a Cart with users in their department or a lower ranking Business Unit
Name: Persistent Cart Sharing

Description: Quickly order items by typing the product’s SKU and its quantity or via CSV upload
Name: Quick Add to Cart

Description: Review of a checkout page
Name: Checkout step - summary

Description: WebConfig ABB
Name: WebConfig

Description: Templates and Slots lets content managers effectively and coherently interact with content using a dedicated template in Spryker—a template with slots. In the Back Office, a content manager has access to all the Storefront pages and can easily embed content into them. The embedded content is rendered by the Slot Widget.
Name: CMS Templates & Slots

Description: Content Creation Workflows/Approvals
Name: Content Creation Workflows/Approvals

Description: The Content Items feature lets admins create and preserve small content pieces. Later, they are inserted into CMS blocks and, subsequently, into Storefront pages. Content items are rendered on Storefront using Content Item Widget.
Name: Content Item

Description:
A navigation element is a page section that contains links to shop resources, as well as external resources.
Tree structure to support multiple levels of linking to a range of sources
Name: Navigation

Description:
Storefront user can select variants per product in a set, add an individual or all products from the set to cart.
A Back Office user can add product sets to any page by creating a product set content item and adding it to CMS pages and blocks.
Name: Product Sets

Description: create content redirects to increase store's search engine visibility
Name: URL Redirects

Description:
HTML page that you can create and edit in the Back Office using the WYSIWYG editor. 
Implementes page templating, validity period, store relation and content widgets.
Name: CMS Pages / Landing Pages

Description: CRM integration for Case Management/Ticketing Visibility
Name: Case Management/Ticketing Visibility
Comments:
Integration with SalesForce. Only frontend effor estimated.
See "Storefront Case Management/Ticketing Visibility"

Description: The Business on Behalf feature lets you have multiple Company Users per Customer Account with the possibility to assign one Company User to be a default user. This default user can switch between the assigned business units
Name: Business on Behalf

Description: Non-physical product support
Name: Downloadable/virtual products

Description: On the Company Account page, the user has a clear overview of their business' structure, hierarchy, shipping and billing addresses, other users in their Business Unit
Name: Company Account

Description: Price quote is requested from platform distributors not platform owner itself.
Name: Marketplace distributor RFQ

Description: Customer Access lets store administrators define whether certain information is visible to logged-out users: price, order-place-submit, add-to-cart,wishlist, shopping-list
Name: Customer Access

Description: A customer account contains the following customer information about the Storefront: Contact details, Addresses, Order history, Preferences, such as language and shipping options
Name: Customer Accounts

Description: Customer Groups used to organize customers into groups to help you target users for discounts and promotions.
Name: Customer Groups

Description: Admin or internal user can login as specific customer
Name: Customer impersonation

Description:
The feature with an secure password policy prevents brute-force.
Block a Storefront user account for some time after a certain number of login attempts.
Enforce the use of strong passwords by defining requirements for a password.
Name: Customer Login

Description:
Customer registration is done by double opt-in. A double opt-in occurs when a user signs up, and an email with a registration confirmation link is sent to them. After they click the verification link, their account is activated.
Registration via checkout is available.
Name: Customer Registration

Description: The File Manager feature lets you upload and manage your assets (media files) effectively
Name: File Manager

Description: new customers can register their company through a self-service registration form in your B2B online shop
Name: Registration of new Company

Description: A cart rule is a discount that applies to a cart once all the decision rules linked to the cart rule are fulfilled.
Name: Cart rule

Description:
Activate a discount rule based on a shipment carrier, a shipment method, or a shipment price.
Based on custom shipment pre-check plugin to checkout.
Name: Discounts based on shipment

Description: The Discount Management feature lets shop owners provide free value to their customers by discounting the percentage or fixed sum of an order’s subtotal, or an item’s price on predefined conditions.
Name: Promotions & Discounts

Description: A voucher is a discount that applies when a customer enters an active voucher code on the Cart page.
Name: Vouchers

Description: Downloading a CSV file with the codes from Backoffice.
Name: Vouchers - export

Description: Import a CSV file with codes with reference to a Discount from Backoffice
Name: Vouchers - import

Description: Customers can go to the Order History page in their Customer Account and reorder either the entire order or individual items from it.
Name: Reorder

Description: Allowing users to log in to the Spryker Back Office with their Identity Access Manager credentials (OOTB integration with the MS Azure Active Directory)
Name: SSO for Administrators

Description: Allowing customers to log in with SSO based authentication
Name: SSO for Customers

Description: Allowing customers to log in with Auth0 based authentication
Name: SSO for Merchants

Description: Allow customers to opt-in for automated notifications when any unavailable product becomes available again.
Name: Availability Notification

Description: Merchant Offers help avoid confusing duplications of products in the Marketplace
Name: Merchant Product Offers

Description:
OOTB behaviour is when the order is made, the stock is not updated automatically in the system, this may be done manually or via customisation.
OOTB availability driven by OMS.
Covers Merchant Warehauses from Marketplace PCB.
Name: Stock and Availability management

Description:
Configure/import (from CSV) warehouses and assing them to store or storesin the Back Office.
Ability to define warehouse address that will be used as the shipping origin address by importing the warehouse address data.
Covers Merchant Warehauses from Marketplace PCB.
Name: Warehouse Management

Description: The Back Office Translations feature introduces a way to translate the Administration interface (Zed) into different languages
Name: Back Office Translations

Description: Store and manage basic text information in a variety languages
Name: Glossary Management

Description: Translations of content visible on Storefront
Name: Storefront Translations

Description: Ability to introduce convenient way to find the necessary and relevant merchants and their products according to certain merchant categories.
Name: Merchant Category

Description: The Operator can create, edit, and approve Merchants and Merchant Users, allowing them access to the Merchant Portal.
Name: Merchant Management

Description: The Marketplace Merchant Portal Core enables server configuration and basic functions of the Merchant Portal application, such as secure login, GUI tables, and dashboards.
Name: Merchant Portal

Description: Ability for Merchant users to login into Merchant Portal. Inbuild authorisation.
Name: Merchant Portal Login

Description:
The Product Offer entity is created when multiple merchants need to sell the same product on the Marketplace.
Marketplace administrators can view and approve or deny merchants’ product offers in the Back Office.
Name: Merchant Product Offers

Description:
The Product Restrictions feature lets merchants define the products that are available to each of their B2B customers.
List of products is crated in Backoffice, not Merchant Portal, or imported via CSV.
Name: Merchant Product Restrictions

Description: Ability for Merchant to create and edit the information on himself that is being displayed on the Merchant profile page to customers.
Name: Merchant Profile

Description: Automated emails related to customer and transactional operations (order status, shipping etc).
Name: Email notifications

Description: Receipient integration with Salesforce
Name: Receipient integration with Salesforce

Description: Integration with external service for SMS handling
Name: SMS notifications

Description: Annual Returns for Backoffice
Name: Annual Returns for Backoffice

Description: Annual Returns. Approval
Name: Annual Returns. Approval

Description: Annual Returns. Create and Status
Name: Annual Returns. Create and Status
Comments: Build data models and state machine

Description: Annual Returns. Credit Memo
Name: Annual Returns. Credit Memo

Description: Annual Returns. Download
Name: Annual Returns. Download

Description: An automated Invoice Generator sends out order invoices to customers via email.
Name: Invoice Generation

Description: The Operator can view and manage general Marketplace and specific Merchant orders
Name: Merchant Orders Management

Description: Ability to cancel an order by customer and in Back Office. Integrated with State Machine.
Name: Order Cancellation

Description: Order Split for multiple ERP
Name: Order Split for multiple ERP

Description: Packing Slip Download
Name: Packing Slip Download for Merchant

Description: Packing Slip
Name: Packing Slip for Merchant

Description:
The Reclamations feature provides a way for administrators to handle all the customer order claims. The shop administrators can create, view, and edit the reclamations in the dedicated section of the Administration Interface.
Reclamation management not available in Merchant Portal.
Name: Reclamations Management in Backoffice

Description:
Refunds handled automatically in the Back Office once the order has been delivered. Your customers can return the entire order or parts thereof by means of the order splitting mechanism. Every order contains information about the total possible refund value and how much has already been refunded.
Refunds management not available in Merchant Portal.
Name: Refunds

Description:
The Return Management capability lets you create and manage returns for sales orders.
The capability consists of a base shop and the marketplace addon
Name: Return Management

Description:
Ability configure if purchased items are to be splitted or not.
As a final step of checkout, for each item in the cart, sales order items are created. By default, each product concrete is splittable.
Name: Splittable Order Items

ID: IAM-Backend administrator user and roles setup
Feature: Backend administrator user and roles setup
Description: Setup of 3 administrator roles and import of admin accounts within ootb format
Name: Backend administrator user and roles setup

Description:
Ability to suggesting product alternatives to support browsing through catalog. Product alternatives let customers jump from one product page to the next until they find a relevant item.
On the product details page of a product that’s a product alternative for another product, you can see a Replacement for.
Name: Alternative Products

Description: Manually manage orders (also create) via Back Office
Name: Order Management

Description: The State Machine allows to implement processes and map out business workflows, model the order process with states and transitions.
Name: State Machine Modelling

Description: Manage product catalog with customized categories and category pages to easily track and sort your items.
Name: Category Management

Description: add multiple top and sub- category grid overview pages before drilling down to the product level
Name: Category Pages. PLP.

Description: Ability to mark a concrete product as a discontinued product. Discontinued is a product which is no longer produced by its manufacturer. The product may have positive or negative stock.
Name: Discontinued products

Description: A configurable bundle is a product bundle for which a Storefront User selects products on the Storefront. For example, when buying a kitchen set, a customer selects pieces of furniture, like drawers, cupboards, or cabinets, from suggested options.
Name: Configurable Bundle

Description:
The Gift Cards capability lets you create a special product type with a chosen value amount. The purchase of a gift card generates an individual code that can then be used as a payment method during checkout.
When paying for orders with a gift card, the gift cards are considered as an additional payment method.
Name: Gift Card

Description: The Configurable Product feature introduces a new type of product, a configurable product, that customers can customize.
Name: Configurable Product

Description: The Operator can approve Merchant Products to control their product offerings
Name: Merchant Product Approval Process

Description: The Product Barcode feature lets you create barcodes for any kind of entity. By default, barcodes are only generated for products.
Name: Product Barcode

Description: Build a product hierarchy structure with Abstract and Concrete Products
Name: Product Abstraction

Description: With the Product Bundles feature you can tie individual items together and sell them as a package. As opposed to a set, in which products are loosely grouped, the items in a bundle are always sold together.
Name: Product Bundles

Description: The Product Label feature lets product catalog managers highlight the needed products by adding a special type of information—product labels.
Name: Product Labels

Description: The Product Lists feature lets you configure product availability for specific companies by adding their products to an excludelist or allowlist.
Name: Product Lists

Description: The Product Groups feature lets product catalog managers group products by attributes, like color or size. A typical use case is combining the same product in different colors into a product group (not to be confused with product variant).
Name: Product Groups

Description: Define a list of items that will be displayed as comparable or additional products.
Name: Product Relations

Description: Ability for  customers to add star ratings for products and optionally add a comment through a freetext function
Name: Ratings & Reviews

Description: Timed concrete product availability, or product TTL (Time to Live) lets you define when your products are available online and when they are not.
Name: Timed Product Availability

Description: B2B solution. Offer specific prices to different customers
Name: Customer Specific Prices

Description: In B2B commerce transactions, prices are typically negotiated in contracts. Therefore, merchants and their clients, who are usually company business units, expect to see their own prices in the shop.
Name: Merchant Custom Prices

Description: manage and define prices
Name: Net & Gross Price Mode

Description: manage sales and promotion campaigns by scheduling all planned price changes
Name: Scheduled Prices

Description: define individual prices for different order quantities of a product
Name: Volume Prices

Description: All orders can be paid with one or multiple payment methods which the customer can select during checkout.
Name: Payment Method

Description: Spryker offers integrations with several payment providers
Name: Payment Service Provider Integration

Description: Ability to display an overview of the latest statistics and performance
Name: Dashboard

Description: Ability to display an overview of the latest statistics and performance
Name: Dashboard in Merchant Portal

Description: Various kinds of reports for Merchant
Name: Generic Marketplace Report
Comments:
Contain one chart, table with pagination, filtering by: business organization, order status, category, SKU, date range and seller. 
Can be downloaded as CSV

Description: The feature lets you group several images into sets and link them to products. One product can have several named and localized sets of images
Name: Product Images

Description: Ability to see activity related to RFQ
Name: Marketplace distributor RFQ for Backoffice

Description: The Product Options feature lets a Back Office user create and assign product options to abstract products. Product options are product additions that a customer can select on the product detail page before adding the product to the cart.
Name: Product Options

Description: Search by application. Automotive specitic.
Name: Application/Fitmnet

Description: Find End Yoke search component. Automotive specific.
Name: Find End Yoke

Description: With the Quotation Process feature, the B2B customers can ask for special prices, and suppliers can get back to them with a compromise pricing suggestion.
Name: Quotation & Offer Management

Description: Search Preferences; include in Full Text Search/suggestions/completion, Boost
Name: Search Preferences

Description: Manage faced filters to to narrow down search results
Name: Search within facet filter

Description: Visual Search
Name: Visual Search

Description: Year make model search component. Automotive specific.
Name: Year make model

Description: SEO for category pages. Metatags, breadcrumbs, headers
Name: SEO for catalog

Description: SEO for products. Metatags, breadcrumbs, headers
Name: SEO for products

Description: Dedicated documented acting as sitemap
Name: Sitemap

Feature: Setup of local environment, DevOps with Spryker Cloud
Description: Setup of local environment, DevOps with Spryker Cloud
Name: Setup of local environment, DevOps with Spryker Cloud

Description: Store, region, locales creation
Name: Store, region, locales creation

Description: Business logic which controls availability of delivery method in a form of plugin class
Name: Custom availability

Description: Business logic which controls delivery time calculation of delivery method in a form of plugin class
Name: Custom delivery time calculation

Description: Business logic which controls price calculation of delivery method in a form of plugin class
Name: Custom price calculation

Name: Shipment Carriers & Methods management

Description: Save tracking codes per shipment
Name: Tracking code

Name: Permission Management for Shopping Lists

ID: Shopping List & Wish List-Shopping List Management
Description: coordinate orders with the Shopping List feature
Name: Shopping List Management

Description: customers track and save items for later purchase through multiple Wish Lists, which are connected to user accounts
Name: Wish List

Description: validate both customer and warehouse addresses to improve the rate of accuracy when calculating sales tax during the checkout process
Name: Avalara Integration

Description: The Tax feature lets you define taxes for the items. The feature is represented by two entities: tax rates and tax sets.
Name: Manage Tax Rates & Sets

Description: Calculation of price based on data coming from different systems
Name: Vehicle price calculation

Description: Different filter types
Name: Faced filters
Comments: Configuration of filters based on store catalog

Description: Search products by their atrributes, categories and CMS pages
Name: Full-site Search
Comments: Search covered by ootb Spryker engine, ElasticSearch

Description: Literature Library
Name: Literature Library

Description: A CMS block is a piece of reusable content that you can add to multiple CMS pages and templates. For example, with the help of a block, you can add banners to the top of a page or add SEO text to the bottom of a page.
Name: CMS Blocks

ID: Analytics and Reporting-Google Tag Manager and GA4
Description: Embedd Tag Manager and integrate with GA4. Basic tagging in scope
Name: Google Tag Manager and GA4

Description: Management of roles and permissions per Company
Name: Company User Roles and Permissions

Description: All products can be assigned a multitude of attributes to simplify the filter and category functions
Name: Product Attributes

Name: Generic Report

Contain one chart, table with pagination, filtering by: business organization, order status, category, SKU, date range and seller.
